A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I don’t believe Luke\, who wouldn’t kill his father- the worst sith in the lore\, would even attempt to kill his nephew; using hyperspace as a weapon creates conflict with past episodes (why not all ships use droids to hyperspace into the enemy?); comedy not on par with previous installments- this was borderline slapstick; Fin’s side plot was a waste of time\, boring and literally makes him a cancer to the rebels- his negligence gets hundreds killed; Fin’s entire motivation in both films was Rey- then soon as he gets kissed by another girl\, he’s diverted? Is he a flake? ... Beautiful film. Good director. Great cinematography. Just felt Ryan Johnson trolled ALL the previous film’s story arcs.
